result.execSummary:
The defendant Eduardo Velazquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders costs, assessments and surcharges and DNA surcharge. Court will grant 1 year (4-30-15) to pay and failure to pay in full will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eduardo Velazquez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
To the amended charge:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty of amended charge and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 80 days time served.  
A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
The Court orders costs, assessments and surcharges and DNA surcharge.  The Court will grant 1 year (4-30-2015) to pay and failure to pay in full will result in a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Eduardo Velazquez in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Eduardo Velazquez in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to DISORDERLY CONDUCT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B misdemeanor.

Defendant Eduardo Velazquez in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Eduardo Velazquez in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant had requested a plea date today.  State moves to amend to a class A misdemeanor of Intimidation of a Witness, 940.42
Durting plea colloquy between defendant and the Court, defendant states that he is NOT GUILTY and wants his trial.  State withdraws the amendment; defense counsel withdraws plea questionnaire.
Case remains on for jury trial 4-30-2014.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Eduardo Velazquez not in court, in custody, appearance is waived.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting a plea date of 4-9-2014.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Eduardo Velazquez not in court, in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for Erin Karshen for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Karshen had previously  provided available trial dates to the clerk.    Case set for final pretrial on 4-3-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 4-30-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-27-2014.

Defendant Eduardo Velazquez in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Eduardo Velazquez in custody.  Grant Huebner for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CAB; Phillip B; the family member of CAB and Phillip B; their residences, polaces of employment and Hamilton High School

Defendant Eduardo Velazquez in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Eduardo Velazquez in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defense moves to dismiss.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
